result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mark S Milanowski was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Eligible for Substance Abuse Program only AFTER serving the first 3 years of initial confinement.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $600 plus costs plus the DNA surcharge.
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Pay the blood draw fee of $26.45.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment if agent approves. 
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid drivers license. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.

DOT Assessment and comply with safety plan. 
Sign appropriate releases for agent to monitor treatment. 
Comply with all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Dept of Corrections.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  Agent may accept DOT assessment if it is complete enough.

supervisions.notes: Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark S Milanowski in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Mark S Milanowski in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:39 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matter is set for a sentencing at this time.
Court has received the PSI. 
Parties received their copies.
State has no corrections/amendments.
Atty Sheets has no additions/deletions/corrections.

Court addresses a correction on face sheet, with regard to case number.

Defense has no witnesses they will be calling.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court prior to sentencing, recommends 10  year prison sentence with conditions as stated in the PSI.
BAC: .181

Atty Sheets addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court addresses the parties, has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.
Court has reviewed the PSI and criminal complaint and has heard arguments of counsel.
PSI prepared was very well done.
This is a 7th offense OWI.

BY THE COURT:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 9 Years
Initial Confinement for 4 Years
Extended Supervision for 5 Years
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first 3 years of initial confinement
Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
129 Days Credit
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $600 plus costs
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
Pay DNA Surcharge of $250
Drivers License Revoked for 36 Months, retroactive to any administrative suspension
Ignition Interlock Device for 36 Months
DOT Assessment and Comply with Safety Pan BAC :.181
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment if agent approves
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license
AODA and follow treatment recommendations. Agent may accept DOT assessment if it is complete enough
Sign appropriate releases for agent to monitor treatment
Comply with all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Dept of Corrections.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Mark S Milanowski in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Mark S Milanowski in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:39 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 1.
Count 2 would be dismissed.

State requests the Court to order a PSI and set for a sentencing date.
Parties are free to argue.

Atty Sheets concurs, also joins in the recommendation for a PSI.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Defendant concurs there are 6 prior offenses.
Court informs Defendant of charge and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Sheets for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
BAC : .181
Atty Sheets agrees that his client was previously convicted.
Defendant acknowledges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: OWI 7th offense
Count 2: Dismissed

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a PSI, to be completed at least one week prior to sentencing and given to parties.

Atty Sheets does not know if his client has had a PSI done before, if so, would have been at least 8 years ago.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Plea hearing on December 15, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 10, 2014 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Mark S Milanowski in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Mark S Milanowski in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Eric Sheets in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mark S Milanowski appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Sheets
Adjourned initial appearance on September 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark S Milanowski appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Court questions defendant re Public Defender. 
Atty Renc is present.  Explains they are in the process of appointing counsel. 

Court will adjourn for 1 week to allow for the appointment of counsel. 

  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
